intro: Manulea revoluta, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, heart-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, blue, and white, and are often used in horticulture for their ornamental value. Manulea revoluta thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth.
